page.title: 05WETHERBY LIBRARY
page.content: This is one of 75 public libraries in the Leeds area, it is staffed by eight people - one of whom is a qualifed librarian. Pensioners and mothers with young children use the library during the morning, school children come in after school and teenagers and working men and women come in the evening. At any one time there are about 11,000 books on the shelves and a similar number on loan. About 1000 books are lent to the 250 or so borrowers every day. Other services offered by the library include school visits - so that children can learn how to use the library and visits to play-groups for story-telling. Tourist pamphlets and a local societies register is kept in the library. There are large print books for the partially sighted and books on cassettes for the blind. A meeting room is available for hire.
